   38: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   39:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   40:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   41: 	 get_columns_and_rows/1, exit_initial/1, job_control_local/1,
   42: 	 job_control_remote/1,stop_during_init/1,wrap/1,
   43:          shell_history/1, shell_history_resize/1, shell_history_eaccess/1,
   44:          shell_history_repair/1, shell_history_repair_corrupt/1,
   45:          shell_history_corrupt/1,
   46:          shell_history_custom/1, shell_history_custom_errors/1,
   47: 	 job_control_remote_noshell/1,ctrl_keys/1,
   48:          get_columns_and_rows_escript/1,
   49:          shell_get_password/1,

   69: -export([test_invalid_keymap/1, test_valid_keymap/1]).
   70: %% Exports for custom shell history module
   71: -export([load/0, add/1]).
   72: %% For custom prompt testing
   73: -export([prompt/1]).
   74: -record(tmux, {peer, node, name, orig_location }).
   75: suite() ->
   76:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   77:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   78: 
   79: all() ->
   80:     [{group, to_erl},
   81:      {group, tty}].
   82: 
   83: groups() ->
   84:     [{to_erl,[],
   85:       [get_columns_and_rows_escript,get_columns_and_rows,
   86:        exit_initial, job_control_local,
   87:        job_control_remote, job_control_remote_noshell,
   88:        ctrl_keys, stop_during_init, wrap,
   89:        shell_invalid_ansi,
   90:        shell_get_password,
   91:        {group, shell_history},
   92:        {group, remsh}]},
   93:      {shell_history, [],
   94:       [shell_history,
   95:        shell_history_resize,
   96:        shell_history_eaccess,
   97:        shell_history_repair,
   98:        shell_history_repair_corrupt,
   99:        shell_history_corrupt,
  100:        {group, sh_custom}
  101:       ]},
  102:      {sh_custom, [],
  103:       [shell_history_custom,
  104:        shell_history_custom_errors]},
  105:      {remsh, [],
  106:       [remsh_basic,
  107:        remsh_error,
  108:        remsh_longnames,
  109:        remsh_no_epmd,
  110:        remsh_expand_compatibility_25,
  111:        remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version]},
  112:      {tty,[],
  113:       [{group,tty_unicode},
  114:        {group,tty_latin1},
  115:        test_invalid_keymap, test_valid_keymap,
  116:        shell_suspend,
  117:        shell_full_queue,
  118:        external_editor,
  119:        external_editor_visual,
  120:        shell_ignore_pager_commands
  121:       ]},
  122:      {tty_unicode,[parallel],
  123:       [{group,tty_tests},
  124:        shell_invalid_unicode,
  125:        external_editor_unicode

  127:        %% shell_unicode_wrap,
  128:        %% shell_delete_unicode_wrap,
  129:        %% shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap,
  130:        %% shell_update_window_unicode_wrap
  131:       ]},
  132:      {tty_latin1,[],[{group,tty_tests}]},
  133:      {tty_tests, [parallel],
  134:       [shell_navigation, shell_multiline_navigation, shell_multiline_prompt,
  135:        shell_xnfix, shell_delete, shell_format,

  145: 
  146: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  147:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  148:     Term = os:getenv("TERM", "dumb"),
  149:     os:putenv("TERM", "vt100"),
  150:     [{term,Term}|Config].
  151: 
  152: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  153:     Term = proplists:get_value(term,Config),
  154:     os:putenv("TERM",Term),
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: init_per_group(to_erl, Config) ->
  158:     case rtnode:get_progs() of
  159:         {error, Error} ->
  160:             {skip, Error};
  161:         _ ->
  162:             DefShell = rtnode:get_default_shell(),
  163:             [{default_shell,DefShell}|Config]
  164:     end;
  165: init_per_group(remsh, Config) ->
  166:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  167:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  168:         new -> Config
  169:     end;
  170: init_per_group(shell_history, Config) ->
  171:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  172:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  173:         new -> Config
  174:     end;
  175: init_per_group(tty, Config) ->
  176:     case string:split(tmux("-V")," ") of
  177:         ["tmux",[Num,$.|_]] when Num >= $3, Num =< $9 ->
  178:             tmux("kill-session"),
  179:             "" = tmux("-u new-session -x 50 -y 60 -d"),
  180:             ["" = tmux(["set-environment '",Name,"' '",Value,"'"])
  181:              || {Name,Value} <- os:env()],
  182:             Config;
  183:         ["tmux", Vsn] ->
  184:             {skip, "invalid tmux version " ++ Vsn ++ ". Need vsn 3 or later"};
  185:         Error ->
  186:             {skip, "tmux not installed " ++ Error}
  187:     end;
  188: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= tty_unicode;
  189:                                    Group =:= tty_latin1 ->
  190:     [Lang,_] =
  191:         string:split(
  192:           os:getenv("LC_ALL",
  193:                     os:getenv("LC_CTYPE",
  194:                               os:getenv("LANG","en_US.UTF-8"))),"."),
  195:     case Group of
  196:         tty_unicode ->
  197:             [{encoding, unicode},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".UTF-8"}]}|Config];
  198:         tty_latin1 ->
  199:             % [{encoding, latin1},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".ISO-8859-1"}]}|Config],
  200:             {skip, "latin1 tests not implemented yet"}
  201:     end;
  202: init_per_group(sh_custom, Config) ->
  203:     %% Ensure that ERL_AFLAGS will not override the value of the shell_history variable.
  204:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-noshell","-kernel","shell_history","not_overridden"]),
  205:     try erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, shell_history], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  206:         {ok, not_overridden} ->
  207:             Config;
  208:         _ ->
  209:             SkipText = "shell_history variable is overridden (probably by ERL_AFLAGS)",
  210:             {skip, SkipText}
  211:     catch
  212:         C:R:Stk ->
  213:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  214:             {skip, "Unexpected error"}
  215:     after
  216:         peer:stop(Peer)
  217:     end;
  218: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  219:     Config.
  220: 
  221: end_per_group(tty, _Config) ->
  222:     Windows = string:split(tmux("list-windows"), "\n", all),
  223:     lists:foreach(
  224:       fun(W) ->
  225:               case string:split(W, " ", all) of
  226:                   ["0:" | _] -> ok;
  227:                   [No, _Name | _] ->
  228:                       "" = os:cmd(["tmux select-window -t ", string:split(No,":")]),
  229:                       ct:log("~ts~n~ts",[W, os:cmd(lists:concat(["tmux capture-pane -p -e"]))])
  230:               end
  231:       end, Windows),
  232: %    "" = os:cmd("tmux kill-session")
  233:     ok;
  234: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  235:     Config.
  236: 
  237: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) ->
  238:     Path = [Func,
  239:             [proplists:get_value(name,P) ||
  240:                 P <- [proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config,[])] ++
  241:                     proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config,[])]],
  242:     [{tc_path, lists:concat(lists:join("-",lists:flatten(Path)))} | Config].
  243: 
  244: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  245:     GroupProperties = proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties, Config),
  246:     case (GroupProperties =/= false) andalso proplists:get_value(parallel, GroupProperties, false) of
  247:         true -> ok;
  248:         false ->
  249:             %% Terminate any connected nodes. They may disturb test cases that follow.
  250:             lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
  251:                                   catch erpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, [])
  252:                           end, nodes()),
  253:             ok
  254:     end.
  255: 
  256: %%-define(DEBUG,1).
  257: -ifdef(DEBUG).
  258: -define(dbg(Data),ct:pal("~p",[Data])).
  259: -else.
  260: -define(dbg(Data),noop).
  261: -endif.
  262: 
  263: string_to_term(Str) ->
  264:     {ok,Tokens,_EndLine} = erl_scan:string(Str ++ "."),
  265:     {ok,AbsForm} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  266:     {value,Value,_Bs} = erl_eval:exprs(AbsForm, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
  267:     Value.
  268: 
  269: run_unbuffer_escript(Rows, Columns, EScript, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut) ->
  270:     DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  271:     TmpFile = filename:join(DataDir, "tmp"),
  272:     ok = file:write_file(TmpFile, <<>>),
  273:     CommandModifier =
  274:         case {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} of
  275:             {false, false} -> "";
  276:             {true, false} -> io_lib:format(" < ~s", [TmpFile]);
  277:             {false, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile]);
  278:             {true, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s < ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile, TmpFile])
  279:         end,
  280:     Command = io_lib:format("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty rows ~p; stty columns ~p; escript ~s ~s\"",
  281:                             [Rows, Columns, EScript, CommandModifier]),
  282:     %% io:format("Command: ~s ~n", [Command]),
  283:     Out = os:cmd(Command),
  284:     %% io:format("Out: ~p ~n", [Out]),
  285:     string_to_term(Out).
  286: 
  287: get_columns_and_rows_escript(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  288:     ExpectUnbufferInstalled =
  289:         try
  290:             "79" = string:trim(os:cmd("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty columns 79 ; tput cols\"")),
  291:             true
  292:         catch
  293:             _:_ -> false
  294:         end,
  295:     case ExpectUnbufferInstalled of
  296:         false ->
  297:             {skip,
  298:              "The unbuffer tool (https://core.tcl-lang.org/expect/index) does not seem to be installed.~n"
  299:              "On Ubuntu/Debian: \"sudo apt-get install expect\""};
  300:         true ->
  301:             DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  302:             IoColumnsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_columns.erl"),
  303:             IoRowsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_rows.erl"),
  304:             [
  305:              begin
  306:                  {ok, 42} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut),
  307:                  {ok, 99} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut)
  308:              end
  309:              ||
  310:                 {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} <- [{false, false}, {true, false}, {false, true}]
  311:             ],
  312:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, true, true),
  313:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, true, true),
  314:             ok
  315:     end.
  316: 
  317: %% Test that the shell can access columns and rows.
  318: get_columns_and_rows(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  320: 	old ->
  321:             test_columns_and_rows(old, []);
  322: 	new ->
  323:             test_columns_and_rows(old, ["-oldshell"]),
  324:             test_columns_and_rows(new, [])
  325:     end,
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: test_columns_and_rows(old, Args) ->
  329:     rtnode:run(
  330:       [{putline, ""},
  331:        {putline, "2."},
  332:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  333:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  334:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
  335:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  336:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"}
  337:       ], [], [], Args),
  338: 
  339:     rtnode:run(
  340:       [{putline, ""},
  341:        {putline, "2."},
  342:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  343:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  344:        {expect, "{ok,90}\r\n"},
  345:        {putline,"io:rows()."},
  346:        {expect, "{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  347:       [],
  348:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ",
  349:       Args);
  350: test_columns_and_rows(new, _Args) ->
  351:     rtnode:run(
  352:       [{putline, ""},
  353:        {expect, "1> $"},
  354:        {putline, "2."},
  355:        {expect, "\r\n2\r\n"},
  356:        {expect, "> $"},
  357:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  358:        {expect, "{ok,80}\r\n"},
  359:        {expect, "> $"},
  360:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  361:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,24}\r\n"}
  362:       ]),
  363: 
  364:     rtnode:run(
  365:       [{putline, ""},
  366:        {expect, "1> $"},
  367:        {putline, "2."},
  368:        {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
  369:        {expect, "> $"},
  370:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  371:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,90}\r\n"},
  372:        {expect, "> $"},
  373:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  374:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  375:       [],
  376:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ").
  377: 
  378: shell_navigation(Config) ->
  379: 
  380:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  381: 
  382:     try
  383:         [begin
  384:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}"),
  385:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward
  386:              check_content(Term, "{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}$"),
  387:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  388:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  389:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  390:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  391:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  392:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  393:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  394:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  395:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  396:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',")}),
  397:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  398:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  399:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  400:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b'")}),
  401:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  402:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  403:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  404:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
  405:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  406:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  407:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  408:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  409:              send_tty(Term,"C-H"),
  410:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  411:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  412:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  413:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  414:          end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  415:         ok
  416:     after
  417:         stop_tty(Term)
  418:     end.
  419: shell_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  420:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  421: 
  422:     try
  423:         [begin
  424:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  425:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,"),
  426:              check_location(Term, {0,width("{aaa,")}),
  427:              send_tty(Term,"\n'b"++U++"b',"),
  428:              check_location(Term, {0, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  429:              send_tty(Term,"\nccc}"),
  430:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward (blink)
  431:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  432:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  433:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  434:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  435:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  436:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  437:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  438:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc")}),
  439:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  440:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  441:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  442:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  443:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  444:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  445:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  446:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  447:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  448:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 1}),
  449:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  450:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b'")}),
  451:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  452:              check_location(Term, {-2, width("{aaa,")}),
  453:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  454:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  455:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  456:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  457:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  458:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U)}),
  459:              send_tty(Term,"M-<"),
  460:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
  461:              send_tty(Term,"M->"),
  462:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  463:              check_location(Term, {0,width("ccc")}),
  464:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  465:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  466:              check_location(Term, {0,0}),
  467:              send_tty(Term,"C-h"), % Backspace
  468:              check_location(Term, {-1,width("ccc}")}),
  469:              send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  470:              send_tty(Term, "End"),
  471:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  472:              send_tty(Term,"M-Enter"),
  473:              check_content(Term, ".. ,"),
  474:              check_location(Term, {-1,0}),
  475:              send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  476:              check_location(Term, {-3,0}),
  477:              send_tty(Term,"{'"++U++"',\n\n\nworks}.\n")
  478:             end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  479:         ok
  480:     after
  481:         stop_tty(Term)
  482:     end.
  483: 
  484: shell_format(Config) ->
  485:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","format_shell_func","{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"]}|Config]),
  486:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  487:     EmacsFormat = "\""++DataDir ++ "emacs-format-file\"\n",
  488:     try
  489:         send_tty(Term1,"fun(X) ->\n  X\nend.\n"),
  490:         send_tty(Term1,"Up"),
  491:         %% Note, erl_pp puts 7 spaces before X
  492:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..        X\\s*.. end."),
  493:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  494:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term1)," -x ",200]),
  495:         timer:sleep(1000),
  496:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func(\"emacs -batch \${file} -l \"\n"),
  497:         send_stdin(Term1, EmacsFormat),
  498:         send_stdin(Term1, "\" -f emacs-format-function\").\n"),
  499:         check_content(Term1, "{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"),
  500:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  501:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  502:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  503:         timer:sleep(1000),
  504:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  505:         %% Note, emacs-format puts 8 spaces before X
  506:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  507:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  508:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
  509:         send_stdin(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func({bad,format}).\n"),
  510:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  511:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  512:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  513:         timer:sleep(1000),
  514:         check_content(Term1, "\\Q* Bad format function: {bad,format}\\E"),
  515:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  516:         %% No modifications should be made, when default format function is used
  517:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  518:         ok
  519:     after
  520:         stop_tty(Term1)
  521:     end.
  522: 
  523: shell_multiline_prompt(Config) ->
  524:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","{shell,inverted_space_prompt}"]}|Config]),
  525:     Term2 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","\"...> \""]}|Config]),
  526:     Term3 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","edlin"]}|Config]),
  527:     Term4 = start_tty(Config),
  528:     try
  529:         check_location(Term1, {0, 0}),
  530:         send_tty(Term1,"\na"),
  531:         check_location(Term1, {0, 1}),
  532:         check_content(Term1, "   a"),
  533:         ok
  534:     after
  535:         stop_tty(Term1)
  536:     end,
  537:     try
  538:         check_location(Term2, {0, 0}),
  539:         send_tty(Term2,"\na"),
  540:         check_location(Term2, {0, 1}),
  541:         check_content(Term2, "...> a"),
  542:         ok
  543:     after
  544:         stop_tty(Term2)
  545:     end,
  546:     try
  547:         send_tty(Term3,"\na"),
  548:         check_location(Term3, {0, 1}),
  549:         check_content(Term3, ".. a"),
  550:         ok
  551:     after
  552:         stop_tty(Term3)
  553:     end,
  554:     try
  555:         send_tty(Term4, "shell:multiline_prompt_func(\"-> \").\n"),
  556:         check_content(Term4, "default"),
  557:         send_tty(Term4, "a\nb"),
  558:         check_content(Term4, "-> b"),
  559:         ok
  560:     after
  561:         stop_tty(Term4)
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564: shell_clear(Config) ->
  565: 
  566:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  567:     {Rows, _Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  568: 
  569:     try
  570:         send_tty(Term,"foobar."),
  571:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  572:         check_content(Term, "foobar"),
  573:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  574:         send_tty(Term,"bazbat"),
  575:         check_location(Term, {0, 6}),
  576:         send_tty(Term,"C-L"),
  577:         check_location(Term, {-Rows+1, 6}),
  578:         check_content(Term, "bazbat")
  579:     after
  580:         stop_tty(Term)
  581:     end.
  582: 
  583: shell_xnfix(Config) ->
  584: 
  585:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  586: 
  587:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  588:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  589: 
  590:     As = lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1,"a"),
  591: 
  592:     try
  593:         [begin
  594:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  595:              send_tty(Term,As),
  596:              check_content(Term,[As,$$]),
  597:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - 1}),
  598:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  599:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  600:              send_tty(Term,"aaa"),
  601:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 3}),
  602:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,3 + width(U))],
  603:              send_tty(Term,U),
  604:              %% a{Cols-1}U\naaaaa
  605:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  606:                                  U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  607:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  608:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  609:              send_tty(Term,U),
  610:              %% a{Cols-1}U\nUaaaaa
  611:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  612:                                  U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  613:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  614:              %% send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  615:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  616:              %% a{Cols-2}U\nUaaaaa
  617:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  618:              %%                     U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  619:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  620:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  621:              %%                     U,U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  622:              %% send_tty(Term,"aa"),
  623:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  624:              %%                     U,"a\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  625:              %% check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  626:              send_tty(Term,"C-K"),
  627:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  628:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  629:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  630:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  631:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  632:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  633:              ok
  634:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  635:     after
  636:         stop_tty(Term)
  637:     end.
  638: 
  639: 
  640: %% Characters that are larger than 2 wide need special handling when they
  641: %% are at the end of the current line.
  642: shell_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  643: 
  644:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  645: 
  646:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  647:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  648: 
  649:     try
  650:         [begin
  651:              FirstLine = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U)*2 + 1,"a")],
  652:              OtherLineA = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"a")],
  653:              OtherLineB = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"b")],
  654:              OtherLineC = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"c")],
  655:              OtherLineD = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"d")],
  656:              send_tty(Term,FirstLine),
  657:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  658:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  659: 
  660:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineA),
  661:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  662:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  663: 
  664:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineB),
  665:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  666:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  667: 
  668:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineC),
  669:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  670:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  671: 
  672:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineD),
  673:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  674:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  675: 
  676:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  677:              check_location(Term, {-4, 0}), %% Broken
  678:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  679:              check_location(Term, {-4, width(U)}), %% Broken
  680: 
  681:              send_tty(Term,"DC"), %% Broken
  682:              check_content(Term, ["a.*",U,"$"]),
  683:              check_content(Term, ["^b.*",U,"c$"]),
  684:              check_content(Term, ["^c.*",U,"dd$"]),
  685: 
  686:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  687:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  688:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  689:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  690:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  691:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  692: 
  693:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  694:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  695:     after
  696:         stop_tty(Term)
  697:     end.
  698: 
  699: shell_delete(Config) ->
  700: 
  701:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  702: 
  703:     try
  704: 
  705:         [ begin
  706:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  707:               check_content(Term, "> a$"),
  708:               check_location(Term, {0, 1}),
  709:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  710:               check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  711:               check_content(Term, ">$"),
  712:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  713:               send_tty(Term,U),
  714:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a, U])}),
  715:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  716:               send_tty(Term,U),
  717:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U,$a,U])}),
  718:               check_content(Term, ["> a",U,$a,U,"$"]),
  719:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  720:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  721:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  722:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  723:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  724:               send_tty(Term,U),
  725:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U])}),
  726:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  727:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  728:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  729:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  730:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  731:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  732:               check_content(Term, ["> a$"]),
  733:               send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  734:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  735:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  736:               check_location(Term, {0, width([])})
  737:           end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  738:     after
  739:         stop_tty(Term)
  740:     end.
  741: 
  742: %% When deleting characters at the edge of the screen that are "large",
  743: %% we need to take special care.
  744: shell_delete_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  745: 
  746:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  747: 
  748:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  749:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  750: 
  751:     try
  752:         [begin
  753:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  754:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  755:              send_tty(Term,[U,U,"aaaaa"]),
  756:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,U,"aaaaa$"]),
  757:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,5+2)],
  758:              check_location(Term,{0,-Col}),
  759:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  760:              check_content(Term,"> a* \n"),
  761:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 1}),
  762:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  763:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  764:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 2}),
  765:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  766:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U," \n"]),
  767:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 3}),
  768:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  769:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"\n"]),
  770:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  771:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 4}),
  772:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  773:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"a\n"]),
  774:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  775:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 5}),
  776:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  777:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  778:     after
  779:         stop_tty(Term)
  780:     end.
  781: 
  782: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  783: %% to take extra care
  784: shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap(Config) ->
  785: 
  786:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  787: 
  788:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  789:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  790: 
  791:     try
  792:         [begin
  793:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  794:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  795:              send_tty(Term,["a",U,"aaaaa"]),
  796:              check_content(Term,["\na",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  797:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  798:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  799:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  800:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  801:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  802:              check_content(Term,["> a* \n"]),
  803:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  804:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  805:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  806:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  807:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  808:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"a\n"]),
  809:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  810:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  811:     after
  812:         stop_tty(Term)
  813:     end.
  814: 
  815: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  816: %% to take extra care
  817: shell_update_window_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  818: 
  819:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  820: 
  821:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  822:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  823: 
  824:     try
  825:         [begin
  826:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U) + 1,"a")),
  827:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  828:              send_tty(Term,[U,"aaaaa"]),
  829:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  830:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols+1]),
  831:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\naaaaa$"]),
  832:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols]),
  833:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  834:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  835:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  836:     after
  837:         stop_tty(Term)
  838:     end.
  839: 
  840: shell_transpose(Config) ->
  841: 
  842:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  843: 
  844:     Unicode = [[$a]] ++ hard_unicode(),
  845: 
  846:     try
  847:         [
  848:          begin
  849:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  850:              [send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U],
  851:              send_tty(Term,"b"),
  852:              [[send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U2] || U2 <- Unicode],
  853:              send_tty(Term,"cde"),
  854:              check_content(Term, ["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  855:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde"])}),
  856:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  857:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  858:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  859:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  860:              check_location(Term, {0, 1+width([U])}),
  861:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  862:              check_content(Term, ["ab",U,Unicode,"cde$"]),
  863:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  864:              check_content(Term, ["ab",hd(Unicode),U,tl(Unicode),"cde$"]),
  865:              [send_tty(Term,"C-T") || _ <- lists:seq(1,length(Unicode)-1)],
  866:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,U,"cde$"]),
  867:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  868:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de$"]),
  869:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U])}),
  870:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  871:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de"])}),
  872:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  873:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  874:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  875:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  876:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  877:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  878:          end || U <- Unicode],
  879:         ok
  880:     after
  881:         stop_tty(Term),
  882:         ok
  883:     end.
  884: 
  885: shell_search(C) ->
  886:     Term = start_tty(C),
  887: 
  888:     try
  889:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  890:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  891:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  892:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  893:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  894:         send_tty(Term,[16#1f600]),
  895:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  896:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  897:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  898:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  899:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  900:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  901:         send_tty(Term,"C-a"),
  902:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(C, "'a😀'.")}),
  903:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  904:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  905:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  906:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  907:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  908:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  909:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*a."),
  910:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  911:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  912:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  913:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  914:         send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  915:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  916:         ok
  917:     after
  918:         stop_tty(Term),
  919:         ok
  920:     end.
  921: 
  922: shell_insert(Config) ->
  923:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  924: 
  925:     try
  926:         send_tty(Term,"abcdefghijklm"),
  927:         check_content(Term, "abcdefghijklm$"),
  928:         check_location(Term, {0, 13}),
  929:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  930:         send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  931:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  932:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  933:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  934:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  935:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijklm$"),
  936:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
  937:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  938:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  939:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  940:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijlm$"),
  941:         ok
  942:     after
  943:         stop_tty(Term)
  944:     end.
  945: 
  946: shell_update_window(Config) ->
  947:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  948: 
  949:     Text = lists:flatten(["abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm"]),
  950:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  951: 
  952:     try
  953:         send_tty(Term,Text),
  954:         check_content(Term,Text),
  955:         check_location(Term, {0, width(Text)}),
  956:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col+1]),
  957:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  958:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  959:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  960:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  961:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col]),
  962:         %% When resizing, tmux does not xnfix the cursor, so it will remain
  963:         %% at the previous locations
  964:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
  965:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  966:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 1}),
  967: 
  968:         %% When we do backspace here, tmux seems to place the cursor in an
  969:         %% incorrect position except when a terminal is attached.
  970:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  971:         %% This really should be {0, -Col}, but sometimes tmux sets it to
  972:         %% {-1, width(Text)} instead.
  973:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col}, {-1, width(Text)}]),
  974: 
  975:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text) div 2 + Col]),
  976:         %% Depending on what happened with the cursor above, the line will be
  977:         %% different here.
  978:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col + width(Text) div 2},
  979:                               {-1, -Col + width(Text) div 2}]),
  980:         ok
  981:     after
  982:         stop_tty(Term)
  983:     end.
  984: shell_small_window_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  985:     Term0 = start_tty(Config),
  986:     tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term0)," -x ",30, " -y ", 6]),
  987:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term0),
  988:     Term = Term0#tmux{orig_location = {Row, Col}},
  989:     Text = ("xbcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  990:         "abcdefghijkl\n"++
  991:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
  992:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklx"),
  993:     try
  994:         send_tty(Term,Text),
  995:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
  996:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  997:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  998:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  999:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1000:         send_tty(Term, "C-Down"),
 1001:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1002:         send_tty(Term, "Left"),
 1003:         check_location(Term, {-1, -4}),
 1004:         send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1005:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1006:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4A"),
 1007:         check_location(Term, {-5, 0}),
 1008:         check_content(Term,"xbc"),
 1009:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4B"),
 1010:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1011:         check_content(Term,"klx"),
 1012:         send_tty(Term, " sets:is_e\t"),
 1013:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1014:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1015:         check_location(Term, {-3, 6}),
 1016:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1017:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1018:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1019:         send_tty(Term, "sets:is_e\t"),
 1020:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1021:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1022:         check_location(Term, {-4, 9}),
 1023:         send_tty(Term, "M-Enter"),
 1024:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1025:         ok
 1026:     after
 1027:         stop_tty(Term)
 1028:     end.
 1029: shell_huge_input(Config) ->
 1030:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1031: 
 1032:     ManyUnicode = lists:duplicate(100,hard_unicode()),
 1033: 
 1034:     try
 1035:         send_tty(Term,ManyUnicode),
 1036:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode_match(Config) ++ "$",
 1037:                       #{ replace => {"\n",""} }),
 1038:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1039:         ok
 1040:     after
 1041:         stop_tty(Term)
 1042:     end.
 1043: shell_receive_standard_out(Config) ->
 1044:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1045:     try
 1046:         send_tty(Term,"my_fun(5) -> ok; my_fun(N) -> receive after 100 -> io:format(\"~p\\n\", [N]), my_fun(N+1) end.\n"),
 1047:         send_tty(Term, "spawn(shell_default, my_fun, [0]). ABC\n"),
 1048:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1049:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that we are at the same location relative to the start.
 1050:         check_content(Term, "3\\s+4\\s+.+>\\sABC"),
 1051:         ok
 1052:     after
 1053:         stop_tty(Term)
 1054:     end.
 1055: %% Test that the shell works when invalid utf-8 (aka latin1) is sent to it
 1056: shell_invalid_unicode(Config) ->
 1057:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1058: 
 1059:     InvalidUnicode = <<$å,$ä,$ö>>, %% åäö in latin1
 1060: 
 1061:     try
 1062:         send_tty(Term,hard_unicode()),
 1063:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode() ++ "$"),
 1064:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1065:         check_content(Term, "illegal character"),
 1066:         %% Send invalid utf-8
 1067:         send_stdin(Term,InvalidUnicode),
 1068:         %% Check that the utf-8 was echoed
 1069:         check_content(Term, "\\\\345\\\\344\\\\366$"),
 1070:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1071:         %% Check that the terminal entered "latin1" mode
 1072:         send_tty(Term,"😀한."),
 1073:         check_content(Term, "\\Q\\360\\237\\230\\200\\355\\225\\234.\\E$"),
 1074:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1075:         %% Check that we can reset the encoding to unicode
 1076:         send_tty(Term,"io:setopts([{encoding,unicode}])."),
 1077:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1078:         check_content(Term, "\nok\n"),
 1079:         send_tty(Term,"😀한"),
 1080:         check_content(Term, "😀한$"),
 1081:         ok
 1082:     after
 1083:         stop_tty(Term),
 1084:         ok
 1085:     end.
 1086: 
 1087: 
 1088: %% Test the we can handle ansi insert, navigation and delete
 1089: %%   We currently can not so skip this test
 1090: shell_support_ansi_input(Config) ->
 1091: 
 1092:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1093: 
 1094:     BoldText = "\e[;1m",
 1095:     ClearText = "\e[0m",
 1096: 
 1097:     try
 1098:         send_stdin(Term,["{",BoldText,"a😀b",ClearText,"}"]),
 1099:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1100:         try check_location(Term, {0, width("{1ma😀bm}")}) of
 1101:             _ ->
 1102:                 throw({skip, "Do not support ansi input"})
 1103:         catch _:_ ->
 1104:                 ok
 1105:         end,
 1106:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀b}")}),
 1107:         check_content(fun() -> get_content(Term,"-e") end,
 1108:                       ["{", BoldText, "a😀b", ClearText, "}"]),
 1109:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1110:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1111:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀")}),
 1112:         send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
 1113:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
 1114:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
 1115:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1116:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1117:         check_content(Term, ["{", BoldText, "a😀"]),
 1118:         ok
 1119:     after
 1120:         stop_tty(Term),
 1121:         ok
 1122:     end.
 1123: 
 1124: shell_expand_location_below(Config) ->
 1125: 
 1126:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1127: 
 1128:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1129:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
 1130: 
 1131:     NumFunctions = lists:seq(0, Row*2),
 1132:     FunctionName = "a_long_function_name",
 1133: 
 1134:     Module = lists:flatten(
 1135:                ["-module(long_module).\n",
 1136:                 "-export([",lists:join($,,[io_lib:format("~s~p/0",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]),"]).\n\n",
 1137:                 [io_lib:format("~s~p() -> ok.\n",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]]),
 1138: 
 1139:     DoScan = fun F([]) ->
 1140:                      [];
 1141:                  F(Str) ->
 1142:                      {done,{ok,T,_},C} = erl_scan:tokens([],Str,0),
 1143:                      [ T | F(C) ]
 1144:              end,
 1145:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- DoScan(Module) ],
 1146:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info]),
 1147: 
 1148:     try
 1149:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1150:         Cols = 80,
 1151: 
 1152:         %% First check that basic completion works
 1153:         send_stdin(Term, "escript:"),
 1154:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1155:         %% Cursor at correct place
 1156:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:")}),
 1157:         %% Nothing after the start( completion
 1158:         check_content(Term, "start\\($"),
 1159: 
 1160:         %% Check that completion is cleared when we type
 1161:         send_stdin(Term, "s"),
 1162:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:s")}),
 1163:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1164: 
 1165:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a term
 1166:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1167:         send_tty(Term, "["),
 1168:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1169:         send_tty(Term, ", test_after]"),
 1170:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", test_after]"],
 1171:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1172:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("[escript:s")}),
 1173:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1174:         send_tty(Term, "C-K"),
 1175: 
 1176:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a long term
 1177:         send_tty(Term, ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"),
 1178:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"],
 1179:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1180:         check_location(Term, {-4, width("[escript:s")}),
 1181:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1182:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1183:         send_stdin(Term, ".\n"),
 1184: 
 1185:         %% Check that we behave as we should with very long completions
 1186:         rpc(Term, fun() ->
 1187:                           {module, long_module} = code:load_binary(long_module, "long_module.beam", Bin)
 1188:                   end),
 1189:         check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1190:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -y 50"]),
 1191:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1192:         Result = 61,
 1193:         Rows1 = 48,
 1194:         send_stdin(Term, "long_module:" ++ FunctionName),
 1195:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1196:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1197: 
 1198:         %% Check that correct text is printed below expansion
 1199:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1200:                                           [1, 7, Result])),
 1201:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1202:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1203:             [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1204:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1205:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1206:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1207:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1208:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1209:                                           [7, Rows1+6, Result])),
 1210:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1211:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1212:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1213:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1214:         %% Overshoot up
 1215:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1216:                                           [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1217:         %% Overshoot down
 1218:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1219:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1220:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1221:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1222:                                           [14, Rows1+13, Result])),
 1223:         check_content(Term, "\n.*a_long_function_name99\\("),
 1224:         send_tty(Term, "Up"),
 1225:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1226:                                           [13, Rows1+12, Result])),
 1227: 
 1228:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1229: 
 1230:         %% We resize the terminal to make everything fit and test that
 1231:         %% expand below displays everything
 1232:         tmux(["resize-window -t ", tty_name(Term), " -y ", integer_to_list(Row+10)]),
 1233:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1234:         send_tty(Term, "\t\t"),
 1235:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name99\\($"),
 1236: 
 1237:         %% Check that doing an expansion when cursor is in xnfix position works
 1238:         send_tty(Term, "BSpace"),
 1239:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:a_long_function_nam$"),
 1240:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1241:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(", long_module:a_long_function_name"), "a")),
 1242:         send_tty(Term, ", "),
 1243:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1244:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1245:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1246:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1247:         check_content(Term, "3> a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1248:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1249:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1250:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1251:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1252:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1253: 
 1254:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1255:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols, "b")),
 1256:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1257:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1258:         check_content(Term, "3> b+\nb+a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1259:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1260:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1261:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1262:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1263:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1264: 
 1265:         ok
 1266:     after
 1267:         stop_tty(Term),
 1268:         ok
 1269:     end.
 1270: 
 1271: shell_expand_location_above(Config) ->
 1272: 
 1273:     Term = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_expand_location","above"]}|Config]),
 1274: 
 1275:     try
 1276:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1277:         send_stdin(Term, "escript:"),
 1278:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1279:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:")}),
 1280:         check_content(Term, "start\\(\n"),
 1281:         check_content(Term, "escript:$"),
 1282:         send_stdin(Term, "s"),
 1283:         send_stdin(Term, "\t"),
 1284:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:s")}),
 1285:         check_content(Term, "\nscript_name\\([ ]+start\\(\n"),
 1286:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1287:         ok
 1288:     after
 1289:         stop_tty(Term),
 1290:         ok
 1291:     end.
 1292: 
 1293: shell_help(Config) ->
 1294:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1295:     try
 1296:         send_stdin(Term, "lists"),
 1297:         send_stdin(Term, "\^[h"),
 1298:         check_content(Term, "List processing functions."),
 1299:         send_stdin(Term, ":all"),
 1300:         send_stdin(Term, "\^[h"),
 1301:         check_content(Term, "-spec all(Pred, List) -> boolean()"),
 1302:         ok
 1303:     after
 1304:         stop_tty(Term),
 1305:         ok
 1306:     end.
 1307: %% Test the we can handle invalid ansi escape chars.
 1308: %%   tmux cannot handle this... so we test this using to_erl
 1309: shell_invalid_ansi(_Config) ->
 1310: 
 1311:     InvalidAnsiPrompt =
 1312:         case proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)) of
 1313:             unicode ->
 1314:                 ["\e]94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e]0m"];
 1315:             latin1 ->
 1316:                 ["\e]94minvalid_test\e]0m"]
 1317:         end,
 1318: 
 1319:     rtnode:run(
 1320:       [{eval, fun() -> application:set_env(
 1321:                          stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1322:                          fun() -> InvalidAnsiPrompt end)
 1323:               end },
 1324:        {putline,"a."},
 1325:        {expect, "a[.]"},
 1326:        {expect, ["\\Q",InvalidAnsiPrompt,"\\E"]}],
 1327:       "", "",
 1328:       ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1329:        "-connect_all","false",
 1330:        "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1331:        "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1332:        "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1333:        "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1334:       ]).
 1335: 
 1336: shell_get_password(_Config) ->
 1337:    
 1338:     rtnode:run(
 1339:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1340:        {putline,"secret\r"},
 1341:        {expect, "\r\n\r\n\"secret\""}]),
 1342: 
 1343:     %% io:get_password only works when run in "newshell"
 1344:     rtnode:run(
 1345:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1346:        {expect, "\\Q{error,enotsup}\\E"}],
 1347:      "","",["-oldshell"]).
 1348: 
 1349: 
 1350: shell_ignore_pager_commands(Config) ->
 1351:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1352:     case code:get_doc(file, #{sources=>[eep48]}) of
 1353:         {error, _} -> {skip, "No documentation available"};
 1354:         _ ->
 1355:             try
 1356:                 send_tty(Term, "h(file).\n"),
 1357:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qmore (y/n)? (y)\\E"),
 1358:                 send_tty(Term, "n\n"),
 1359:                 check_content(Term,"ok"),
 1360:                 send_tty(Term, "C-P"),
 1361:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qh(file).\\E"),
 1362:                 ok
 1363:             after
 1364:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1365:                 ok
 1366:             end
 1367:     end.
 1368: test_valid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1369:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1370:     Term = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "valid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1371:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1372:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1373:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1374:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1375:     try
 1376:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid key"),
 1377:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid function"),
 1378:         send_tty(Term, "asdf"),
 1379:         send_tty(Term, "C-u"),
 1380:         check_content(Term, ">$"),
 1381:         send_tty(Term, "1.\n"),
 1382:         send_tty(Term, "C-b"),
 1383:         check_content(Term, "2>\\s1.$"),
 1384:         ok
 1385:     after
 1386:         stop_tty(Term),
 1387:         ok
 1388:     end.
 1389: 
 1390: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1391:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1392:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1393:     try
 1394:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1395:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1396:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1397:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1398:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1399:         ok
 1400:     after
 1401:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1402:         ok
 1403:     end.
 1404: external_editor(Config) ->
 1405:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1406:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1407:         _ ->
 1408:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1409:             try
 1410:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1411:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1412:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1413:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1414:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1415:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1416:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1417:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1418:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1419:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1420:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1421:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1422:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1423:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1424:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1425:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1426:                 ok
 1427:             after
 1428:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1429:                 ok
 1430:             end
 1431:     end.
 1432: 
 1433: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1434:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1435:         false ->
 1436:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1437:         _ ->
 1438:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1439:             try
 1440:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1441:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1442:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1443:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1444:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1445:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1446:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1447:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1448:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1449:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1450:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1451:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1452:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1453:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1454:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1455:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1456:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1457:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1458:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1459:             after
 1460:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1461:                 ok
 1462:             end
 1463:     end.
 1464: 
 1465: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1466:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1467:     case NanoPath of
 1468:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1469:         _ ->
 1470:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1471:             try
 1472:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1473:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1474:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1475:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1476:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1477:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1478:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1479:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1480:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1481:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1482:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1483:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1484:                 ok
 1485:             after
 1486:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1487:                 ok
 1488:             end
 1489:     end.
 1490: 
 1491: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1492: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1493: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1494: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1495: 
 1496:     [
 1497:      begin
 1498:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1499:          try
 1500:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1501:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1502:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1503:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1504:                        end),
 1505:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1506:          after
 1507:              stop_tty(Term)
 1508:          end
 1509:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1510: 
 1511: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1512: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1513: 
 1514:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1515:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1516:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1517:     %% process.
 1518:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1519: 
 1520:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1521:               post_process_args =>
 1522:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1523:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1524:                                       lists:join(
 1525:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1526:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1527:                         end
 1528:             },
 1529: 
 1530: 
 1531:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1532: 
 1533:     try
 1534:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1535:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1536:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1537:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1538:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1539:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1540:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1541:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1542:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1543:         ok
 1544:     after
 1545:         stop_tty(Term),
 1546:         ok
 1547:     end.
 1548: 
 1549: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1550: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1551: 
 1552:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffered to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffered") =:= false],
 1553: 
 1554:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1555:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1556:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1557:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1558:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1559: 
 1560:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1561:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1562: 
 1563:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1564:               post_process_args =>
 1565:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1566:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1567:                                       lists:join(
 1568:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1569:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1570:                         end
 1571:             },
 1572: 
 1573: 
 1574:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1575: 
 1576:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1577: 
 1578:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1579:         fun F(Char) ->
 1580:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1581:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1582:                 receive
 1583:                     stop ->
 1584:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1585:                 after 0 -> F(Char)
 1586:                 end
 1587:         end,
 1588: 
 1589:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1590:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1591:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1592:                          receive
 1593:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1594:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1595:                          after 1000 ->
 1596:                                  ok
 1597:                          end,
 1598:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1599:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1600:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1601:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1602:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1603:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1604:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1605:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1606:                          end
 1607:                  end)(0)
 1608:         end,
 1609: 
 1610:     try
 1611:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1612:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1613:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1614:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a) end),
 1615:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1616:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1617:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1618:         Pid ! stop,
 1619:         check_content(Term,"b$"),
 1620: 
 1621:         send_tty(Term, "."),
 1622:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1623: 
 1624:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1625:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1626:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term,io,columns,[user]),
 1627:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1628:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1629:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1630:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c) end),
 1631:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1632:         stop_tty(Term),
 1633:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1634:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1635:         check_content(
 1636:           fun() ->
 1637:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])
 1638:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1639:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1640:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1641:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1642:         ok
 1643:     after
 1644:         stop_tty(Term),
 1645:         ok
 1646:     end.
 1647: 
 1648: get(Key,Default) ->
 1649:     case get(Key) of
 1650:         undefined ->
 1651:             Default;
 1652:         Value ->
 1653:             Value
 1654:     end.
 1655: 
 1656: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1657: hard_unicode() ->
 1658:     ZWJ =
 1659:         case os:type() of
 1660:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1661:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1662:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1663:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 🤚🏼
 1664:         end,
 1665:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 😀
 1666:     "한",                   % Hangul
 1667:     "Z̤͔ͧ̑̓","ä͖̭̈̇","lͮ̒ͫ","ǧ̗͚̚","o̙̔ͮ̇͐̇" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1668:      %%"👩‍👩",            % Zero width joiner
 1669:      %%"👩‍👩‍👧‍👦"                % Zero width joiner
 1670:      | ZWJ].
 1671: 
 1672: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1673:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1674: 
 1675: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1676:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1677:         unicode -> U;
 1678:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1679:     end.
 1680: 
 1681: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1682:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1683:         true -> Byte
 1684:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1685: 
 1686: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1687:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1688:         unicode -> U;
 1689:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1690:     end.
 1691: 
 1692: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1693:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1694: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1695:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1696:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1697:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1698:      end || U <- Us].
 1699: 
 1700: width(C, Str) ->
 1701:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1702:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1703:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1704:     end.
 1705: width(Str) ->
 1706:     lists:sum(
 1707:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1708: 
 1709: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1710:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1711:     catch error:undef ->
 1712:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1713:                     2; %% 한
 1714:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1715:                     2; %% hand
 1716:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1717:                     2; %% Skintone
 1718:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1719:                     2; %% smilie
 1720:                true ->
 1721:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1722:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1723:                         true ->
 1724:                             0;
 1725:                         false ->
 1726:                             1
 1727:                     end
 1728:             end
 1729:     end.
 1730: 
 1731: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1732:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1733: tmux(Command) ->
 1734:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1735: 
 1736: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1737:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1738: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1739:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1740: 
 1741: %% Setup a TTY, but do not type anything in terminal
 1742: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1743:     Name = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1744:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1745: 
 1746:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1747:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1748:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1749: 
 1750:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1751: 
 1752:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1753:                    "strace" ->
 1754:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1755:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1756:                        ct:log("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1757:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1758:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1759:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1760:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1761:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1762:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1763:                    "rr" ->
 1764:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1765:                    _ ->
 1766:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1767:                end,
 1768:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1769:                          exec =>
 1770:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1771:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1772: 
 1773:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1774:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1775: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1776:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1777:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1778:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1779:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1780:                          wait_boot => 60_000,
 1781:                          detached => false
 1782:                        },
 1783: 
 1784:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1785:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1786:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1787: 
 1788:     Self = self(),
 1789: 
 1790:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1791:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1792:     %% monitors.
 1793:     spawn(fun() ->
 1794:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1795:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1796:                   receive
 1797:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1798:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1799:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1800:                           ok
 1801:                   end
 1802:           end),
 1803:     unlink(Peer),
 1804: 
 1805:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1806: 
 1807:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1808:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1809:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1810: 
 1811:     spawn(Node,
 1812:           fun() ->
 1813:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1814:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1815:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1816:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1817:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1818:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1819:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1820:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1821:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1822:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1823:           end),
 1824: 
 1825:     #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = Name }.
 1826: 
 1827: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 1828: start_tty(Config) ->
 1829: 
 1830:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 1831: 
 1832:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 1833:     erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 1834:               [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1835:                proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt)]),
 1836: 
 1837:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1838: 
 1839:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1840:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1841:     %% position is.
 1842:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1843: 
 1844:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1845:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1846:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1847:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1848:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1849:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1850: 
 1851: prompt(L) ->
 1852:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1853:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1854:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1855:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 1856: 
 1857: stop_tty(Term) ->
 1858:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 1859:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 1860: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 1861:     ok.
 1862: 
 1863: tty_name(Term) ->
 1864:     Term#tmux.name.
 1865: 
 1866: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 1867:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 1868:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1869:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 1870: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 1871:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1872:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 1873: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 1874:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 1875:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 1876:     [begin
 1877:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 1878:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 1879:      end || V <- Quotes].
 1880: 
 1881: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 1882: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 1883: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 1884:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 1885: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 1886:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 1887: 
 1888: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 1889:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 1890: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 1891:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 1892: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 1893:                Where, Attempt) ->
 1894:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 1895:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 1896:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 1897:                    end, Where) of
 1898:         true -> NewLocation;
 1899:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1900:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 1901:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 1902:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 1903:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 1904:         false ->
