 1905:             timer:sleep(50),
 1906:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 1907:     end.
 1908: 
 1909: get_location(Term) ->
 1910:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1911:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1912:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1913: 
 1914: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1915:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1916:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1917:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1918: 
 1919: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1920:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1921: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1922:     Opts = #{},
 1923:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1924:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1925:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1926:     end,
 1927:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1928:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1929:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1930:                 error ->
 1931:                     OrigContent
 1932:                 end,
 1933:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1934:         {match,_} ->
 1935:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1936:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1937:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1938:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1939:             ct:fail(match);
 1940:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1941:             ok;
 1942:         _ ->
 1943:             timer:sleep(500),
 1944:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1945:     end.
 1946: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1947:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1948: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1949:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1950: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1951:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1952:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1953:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1954:               end,
 1955:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1956:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1957:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1958:                   error ->
 1959:                       OrigContent
 1960:               end,
 1961:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1962:         {match,_} ->
 1963:             ok;
 1964:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1965:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1966:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1967:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1968:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1969:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1970:         _ ->
 1971:             timer:sleep(500),
 1972:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1973:     end.
 1974: 
 1975: get_content(Term) ->
 1976:     get_content(Term, "").
 1977: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1978:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1979:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1980:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1981:             C;
 1982:         [C] ->
 1983:             C
 1984:     end.
 1985: 
 1986: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1987: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1988:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1989: 	old ->
 1990:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1991:         new ->
 1992:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1993:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1994:     end,
 1995:     ok.
 1996: 
 1997: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1998:     rtnode:run(
 1999:       [{putline, ""},
 2000:        {putline, "2."},
 2001:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2002:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2003:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2004:        {putline, ""},
 2005:        {putline, "35."},
 2006:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2007:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2008: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2009:     rtnode:run(
 2010:       [{putline, ""},
 2011:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2012:        {putline, "2."},
 2013:        {expect, "2"},
 2014:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2015:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2016:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2017:        {putline, "35."},
 2018:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2019: 
 2020: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2021:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2022:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2023:         {error, Reason} ->
 2024:             {skip, Reason};
 2025:         Tempdir ->
 2026:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2027:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2028:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2029:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2030:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2031:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2032:             ok
 2033:     end.
 2034: 
 2035: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2036: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2037: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2038: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2039: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2040: %% on the current line.
 2041: %%
 2042: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2043: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2044: %% newline to happen.
 2045: %%
 2046: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2047: %% we should.
 2048: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2049:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2050:         new ->
 2051:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2052:             rtnode:run(
 2053:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2054:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2055:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2056:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2057:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2058:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2059:               ],
 2060:               [],
 2061:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2062:         _ ->
 2063:             ok
 2064:     end,
 2065:     ok.
 2066: 
 2067: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2068: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2069: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2070: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2071: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2072: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2073: %% commands.
 2074: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2075:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2076:     rtnode:run(
 2077:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2078:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2079:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2080:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2081:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2082:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2083:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2084:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2085:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2086:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2087:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2088:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2089:     rtnode:run(
 2090:       [{sleep,100},
 2091:        {putline, ""},
 2092:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2093:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2094:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2095:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2096:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2097:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2098:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2099:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2100:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2101:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2102:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2103:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2104:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2105:       ], [], [],
 2106:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2107:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2108: 
 2109:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2110:     rtnode:run(
 2111:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2112:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2113:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2114:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2115:        ], [], [],
 2116:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2117:     ok.
 2118: 
 2119: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2120:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2121:     rtnode:run(
 2122:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2123:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2124:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2125:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2126:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2127:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2128: 
 2129:     {ok, Logs} =
 2130:         rtnode:run(
 2131:           [{sleep,100},
 2132:            {putline, ""},
 2133:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2134:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2135:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2136:            {expect, "echo"}
 2137:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2138:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2139: 
 2140:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2141:       "erlang.log.1",
 2142:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2143:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2144: 
 2145:     ok.
 2146: 
 2147: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2148:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2149:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2150:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2151:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2152:     try
 2153:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2154:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2155: 
 2156:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2157:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2158:             rtnode:run(
 2159:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2160:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2161:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2162: 
 2163:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2164:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2165: 
 2166:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2167:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2168:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2169:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2170:             rtnode:run(
 2171:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2172:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2173:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2174: 
 2175:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2176: 
 2177:     after
 2178:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2179:     end,
 2180:     ok.
 2181: 
 2182: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2183:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2184: 
 2185:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2186:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2187: 
 2188:     {ok, Logs} =
 2189:         rtnode:run(
 2190:           [{putline, ""},
 2191:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2192:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2193:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2194:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2195: 
 2196:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2197:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2198:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2199:                       false,
 2200:                       Logs),
 2201:     ok.
 2202: 
 2203: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2204:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2205: 
 2206:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2207:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2208: 
 2209:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2210:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2211:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2212:     ok = file:close(D),
 2213: 
 2214:     {ok, Logs} =
 2215:         rtnode:run(
 2216:           [{putline, ""},
 2217:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2218:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2219:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2220:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2221: 
 2222:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2223:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2224:                       Logs),
 2225:     ok.
 2226: 
 2227: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2228:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2229: 
 2230:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2231:     rtnode:run(
 2232:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2233:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2234:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2235:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2236:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2237: 
 2238:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2239:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2240:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2241:     ok = file:close(D),
 2242: 
 2243:     {ok, Logs} =
 2244:         rtnode:run(
 2245:           [{putline, ""},
 2246:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2247:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2248:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2249:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2250:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2251: 
 2252:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2253:     ok.
 2254: 
 2255: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2256: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2257:     try
 2258:         rtnode:run(
 2259:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2260:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2261:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2262:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2263:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2264:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2265:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2266:     catch
 2267:         _:_ ->
 2268:             ok
 2269:     end.
 2270: 
 2271: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2272:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2273:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2274: 
 2275: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2276:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2277:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2278:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2279:     ].
 2280: 
 2281: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2282:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2283:     rtnode:run(
 2284:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2285:        %% {putline, ""},
 2286:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2287:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2288:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2289:        {putline, "echo."},
 2290:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2291:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2292:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2293:     ok.
 2294: 
 2295: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2296: 
 2297:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2298:     %% provider module.
 2299:     rtnode:run(
 2300:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2301:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2302:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2303:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2304: 
 2305:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2306:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2307:     rtnode:run(
 2308:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2309:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2310:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2311:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2312:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2313: 
 2314:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2315:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2316:     rtnode:run(
 2317:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2318:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2319:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2320:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2321:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2322: 
 2323:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2324:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2325:     rtnode:run(
 2326:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2327:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2328:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2329:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2330:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2331:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2332: 
 2333:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2334:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2335:     rtnode:run(
 2336:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2337:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2338:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2339:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2340:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2341:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2342: 
 2343:     ok.
 2344: 
 2345: load() ->
 2346:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2347:         {ok, crash} ->
 2348:             error(crash);
 2349:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2350:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2351:             ok;
 2352:         _ ->
 2353:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2354:     end.
 2355: 
 2356: add(_Line) ->
 2357:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2358:         {ok, crash} ->
 2359:             error(crash);
 2360:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2361:             %% Should return ok
 2362:             {error, badreturn};
 2363:         _ ->
 2364:             io:format("!", [])
 2365:     end.
 2366: 
 2367: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2368: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2369:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2370: 	old ->
 2371: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2372: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2373: 	new ->
 2374: 	    %% New shell tests
 2375: 	    rtnode:run(
 2376:               [{putline, ""},
 2377:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2378:                {putline, "2."},
 2379:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2380:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2381:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2382:                {putline, "s"},
 2383:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2384:                {putline, "c"},
 2385:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2386:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2387:                {putline, "35."},
 2388:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2389:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2390:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2391:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2392:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2393:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2394:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2395:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2396:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2397:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2398:                {putline, "c"},
 2399:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2400:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2401:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2402:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2403:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2404:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2405:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2406:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2407:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2408:                {putline, "k"},
 2409:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2410:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2411:                {putline, "c"},
 2412:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2413:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2414:                {putline, "i"},
 2415:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2416:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2417:                {putline, "?"},
 2418:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2419:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2420:                {putline, "h"},
 2421:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2422:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2423:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2424:                {sleep, 100},
 2425:                {putline, ""},
 2426:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2427:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2428:                {sleep, 100},
 2429:                {putline, ""},
 2430:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2431:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2432:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2433:                {putline, "35."},
 2434:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2435:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2436:               ]),
 2437:             ok
 2438:     end.
 2439: 
 2440: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2441: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2442:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2443: 	old ->
 2444: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2445: 	_ ->
 2446:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2447:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2448:             try
 2449:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2450:             after
 2451:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2452:             end
 2453:     end.
 2454: 
 2455: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2456: %% -noshell node.
 2457: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2458:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2459: 	old ->
 2460: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2461: 	_ ->
 2462: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2463:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2464:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2465:             try
 2466:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2467:             after
 2468:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2469:             end
 2470:     end.
 2471: 
 2472: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2473:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2474:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2475:                                    receive die ->
 2476:                                            ok
 2477:                                    end
 2478:                            end),
 2479:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2480:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2481:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2482:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2483: 
 2484:     rtnode:run(
 2485:       [{putline, ""},
 2486:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2487:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2488:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2489:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2490:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2491:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2492:        {putline, "j"},
 2493:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2494:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2495:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2496:        {putline, "c"},
 2497:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2498:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2499:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2500:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2501:        {expect, PidStr},
 2502:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2503:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2504:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2505:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2506:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2507:        {putline, "j"},
 2508:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2509:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2510:        {putline, "c"},
 2511:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2512:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2513:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2514:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2515:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2516:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2517:        {putline, "j"},
 2518:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2519:        {putline, "c"},
 2520:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2521:        {sleep, 100},
 2522:        {putline, "35."},
 2523:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2524:       ], RemNode),
 2525:     Pid ! die,
 2526:     ok.
 2527: 
 2528: %% Tests various control keys.
 2529: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2530:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2531:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2532:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2533:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2534:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2535:     rtnode:run(
 2536:       [{putline,""},
 2537:        {putline,"2."},
 2538:        {expect,"2"},
 2539:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2540:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2541:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2542:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2543:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2544:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2545:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2546:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2547:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2548:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2549:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2550:     ok.
 2551: 
 2552: wordLeft() ->
 2553:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2554:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2555:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2556:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2557: 
 2558: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2559:     End = "\eOF",
 2560:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2561:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2562: 
 2563: wordRight() ->
 2564:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2565:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2566:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2567:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2568: 
 2569: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2570:     Home = "\eOH",
 2571:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2572:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2573: 
 2574: %% Test that -remsh works
 2575: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2576:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2577:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2578:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2579: 
 2580:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2581:                {putline,"node()."},
 2582:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2583: 
 2584:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2585: 
 2586:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2587:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2588:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2589:     rtnode:run(
 2590:       PreCmds ++
 2591:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2592:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2593:           PostCmds,
 2594:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2595: 
 2596:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2597:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2598: 
 2599:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2600:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2601:                [], " ",
 2602:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2603: 
 2604:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2605: 
 2606:     ok.
 2607: 
 2608: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2609: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2610:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2611:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2612: 
 2613: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2614:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2615:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2616:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2617:      {putline, "s"},
 2618:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2619:      {putline, "c"},
 2620:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2621:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2622: 
 2623: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2624: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2625:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2626:     Domain =
 2627:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2628:             [] ->
 2629:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2630:             _ -> ""
 2631:         end,
 2632:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2633:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2634:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2635:             try
 2636:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2637:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2638:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2639:                 try
 2640:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2641:                            SNode,
 2642:                            STPid,
 2643:                            [{putline, ""},
 2644:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2645:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2646:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2647:                            CNode,
 2648:                            CTPid,
 2649:                            [{putline, ""},
 2650:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2651:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2652:                 after
 2653:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2654:                 end
 2655:             after
 2656:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2657:             end;
 2658:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2659:             Else
 2660:     end.
 2661: 
 2662: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2663: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2664:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2665:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2666:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2667:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2668:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2669:             try
 2670:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2671:                        SNode,
 2672:                        STPid,
 2673:                        [{putline, ""},
 2674:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2675:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2676:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2677:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2678:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2679:                 try
 2680:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2681:                            CNode,
 2682:                            CTPid,
 2683:                            [{putline, ""},
 2684:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2685:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2686:                 after
 2687:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2688:                 end
 2689:             after
 2690:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2691:             end;
 2692:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2693:             Else
 2694:     end.
 2695: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2696:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2697:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2698:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2699:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2700:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2701:             try
 2702:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2703:                        STPid,
 2704:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2705:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2706:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2707:             after
 2708:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2709:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2710:             end;
 2711:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2712:     end.
 2713: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2714:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2715:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2716:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2717:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2718:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2719:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2720:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2721:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2722:                     try
 2723:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2724:                             STPid,
 2725:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2726:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2727:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2728:                     after
 2729:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2730:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2731:                     end;
 2732:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2733:             end
 2734:     end.
 2735: 
 2736: printed_atom(A) ->
 2737:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
